bugs@pettay.fi
comments.text:
This is pretty clear. If I open a new tab, I can see back button although there is
no session history entries to go back.
And this isn't a Joke Bug, but a UI consistency bug.
comments.creator: bugs@pettay.fi
comments.raw_text:

comments.creator: pisoir@gmail.com
comments.author: pisoir@gmail.com
comments.text:
I agree with Olli. Since Firefox 10 the forward button is hidden when there is no "forward session". Why not to hide back button, when there is no "backward session"? It is definitely an inconsistency.
Maybe off this bug, but why not to hide the buttons also when "Use small icons" is checked (View->Toolbars->Customize->Use small icons)? I quite don't see the point.
comments.raw_text:
I agree with Olli. Since Firefox 10 the forward button is hidden when there is no "forward session". Why not to hide back button, when there is no "backward session"? It is definitely an inconsistency.
Maybe off this bug, but why not to hide the buttons also when "Use small icons" is checked (View->Toolbars->Customize->Use small icons)? I quite don't see the point.
